creator: vannawilmer@gmail.com
summary: "Open In New Tab" disappears from or does not even show up in right click menu

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Build ID: 20180516032328

Steps to reproduce:

In the right click menu, if I select "Open in New Private Window", the "Open In New Tab" option disappears from my right click menu.  As well, there are times when I open a new browser window and the "Open in New Tab" option is missing from the right click menu.  However, in both instances, if I have the right click menu open, I can still use the "T" keyboard shortcut to open a new tab despite the option no longer appearing.


Actual results:

Exactly what I described above.  Sometimes by Exiting Firefox and restarting the Browser I can get the Open in New Tab menu item to reappear but not always.


Expected results:

In the past, opening a New Private Window had NO effect on the right menu options.
comments.author: vannawilmer@gmail.com

comments.text:
Opening a new private window should hide the "Open new window" context menuitem. Can you reproduce this with mozregression? It would really help us to find when this stopped working for you.

http://mozilla.github.io/mozregression/
comments.author: jaws@mozilla.com

comments.text: I will install mozregression and send you my results next week when I am back at home with my computer as I am away for the weekend.  Please stand by and thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
comments.author: vannawilmer@gmail.com

comments.text: Thanks, I will leave the needinfo on until we get a response so that this doesn't get forgotten.
comments.author: jaws@mozilla.com
